1: The city has recently implemented stricter environmental regulations to combat air pollution.
(1) The city has relaxed environmental regulations to improve air quality.
(2) The city has imposed stricter rules to reduce air pollution.
(3) The city has stopped enforcing any environmental regulations.
(4) The city is unsure about enforcing stricter environmental laws.
2: Although the novel received mixed reviews, its unique narrative style garnered a lot of attention.
(1) The novel received universal praise for its unique narrative style.
(2) The novel was praised for its traditional writing style.
(3) Despite the mixed reviews, the novel's narrative style attracted significant attention.
(4) Critics universally disliked the novel and its narrative style.
3: The director's decision to cast the unknown actor was met with skepticism, but the actor's performance was widely praised.
(1) Despite initial doubts, the actor's performance earned widespread praise.
(2) The director was criticized for casting an unknown actor, but the actor performed poorly.
(3) The director cast a famous actor, and their performance was very well received.
(4) The actor's performance was criticized, and the director's decision was supported.
4: While the company initially struggled, its ability to adapt to new technology helped it achieve significant growth.
(1) The company failed to adapt to new technology and remained stagnant.
(2) The company struggled but later succeeded by embracing new technology.
(3) The company was always successful due to its use of new technology.
(4) The company relied on traditional methods and failed to grow.
